title: Ariane 6 set for maiden launch from French Guiana
summary: Europe’s new heavy-lift rocket, Ariane 6, is set for its maiden flight. Liftoff is expected to occur at the opening of a four-hour launch window on Tuesday, July 9, at 18:00 UTC, with the window extending to 22:00 UTC. Ariane 6 will fly from the Ensemble de Lancement Ariane-4 (ELA-4) launch pad at the Guiana Space Centre in Kourou, French Guiana.

title: Launch Roundup: SpaceX flies more customer payloads and Ariane 6 debuts
summary: As many as four SpaceX Falcon 9 missions and the long-delayed inaugural flight of Ariane 6 make up the roster for this week’s launch schedule. The four SpaceX missions will be split evenly between Starlink and two payloads for other customers.

title: Ariane 6 Ready for Debut Flight
summary: Ariane 6, the European Space Agency and Arianespace’s next-generation rocket, is ready to perform its maiden flight on July 9, 2024.

title: NASA Mission to Study Mysteries in the Origin of Solar Radio Waves
summary: NASA’s CubeSat Radio Interferometry Experiment, or CURIE, is scheduled to launch July 9, 2024, to investigate the unresolved origins of radio waves coming from the Sun. Scientists first noticed these radio waves decades ago, and over the years they’ve determined the radio waves come from solar flares and giant eruptions on the Sun called coronal […]

title: The Young Professional Satellite - From Theory to Reality (episode 2)
summary: In the second episode of this docu series, we take a closer look into what it took to build ESA’s Young Professional Satellite (YPSat). YPSat’s mission objectives are to capture the key moments of Ariane 6’s inaugural flight and take in-orbit pictures of Earth and space. To achieve this, the satellite requires the multiple sub-systems to work in harmony and adhere to a pre-defined mission sequence.

title: Europe set for crucial first launch of Ariane 6
summary: Europe is on the brink of a crucial moment as the Ariane 6 launch vehicle prepares for its inaugural flight Tuesday.

title: Space Team Europe for Ariane 6: Alexis Van Lysebeth
summary: They say it takes a village to raise a child. To launch a rocket, we have the combined expertise and passion of Space Team Europe. Alexis Van Lysebeth is one of many making the first Ariane 6 launch possible and has been interviewed as part of a series highlighting some of the people that make up this dream team.

title: Live coverage: European Space Agency makes final preparations for inaugural Ariane 6 launch
summary: The first flight of the rocket will carry several payloads unto low Earth orbit for a variety of customers, including NASA. Teams are targeting launch from French Guiana on July 9, 2024, during a window that runs from 3-7 p.m. GFT (2-6 p.m. EDT, 1900-2300 UTC).
